summary: This bill, the Shingle Springs Band of Miwok Indians Land Transfer Act of 2025, aims to take specific federal land in California into trust for the benefit of the Shingle Springs Band of Miwok Indians. It revokes a previous public land order, transferring jurisdiction of the land to the Secretary of the Interior. The Secretary is mandated to place approximately 80 and 185 acres of land into trust. The bill also declares the land part of the Tribe's reservation, prohibiting gaming and specifying administrative procedures. A review and potential survey of the land are included, along with key definitions.
